string-array.item: A TextView is a widget used to display text in an Android application. Its one of the most commonly used UI elements in Android apps for displaying labels, messages, instructions, etc.TextView can be customized in terms of text size, color, font style, alignment, and more.

An ImageView is a widget used to display images in an Android application. Its used when you want to show images such as icons, photos, logos, etc., in your apps UI. ImageView can load images from various sources like drawable resources, assets, URLs, etc. It supports various scale types (e.g., centerCrop, fitXY, fitCenter) to control how the image is displayed within the ImageView bounds. Like TextView, ImageView is also a subclass of the View class and can be added to layout XML files or created dynamically in code.

ConstraintLayout is a flexible layout manager in Android used to create complex and responsive UI designs. It allows you to create layouts by positioning and aligning views relative to each other or relative to the parent layout. Views within a ConstraintLayout are connected or constrained to each other using constraints. Constraints define the position, size, and alignment of views within the layout. ConstraintLayout is preferred over other layouts like RelativeLayout or LinearLayout for its flexibility, performance, and ease of creating responsive UIs. Its part of the AndroidX library and supports features like chains, guidelines, barriers, and more for advanced layout designs.
